thread.title: Lions TE Eric Ebron exits with knee injury
thread.title_full: Lions TE Eric Ebron exits with knee injury

author: detroitnews.com
title: Lions TE Eric Ebron exits with knee injury
text:
Lions quarterback Matthew Stafford calls out at the line of scrimmage in the first quarter of the game between the Detroit Lions and the Seattle Seahawks at CenturyLink Field in Seattle, Washington on Oct. 5, 2015. The Seahawks won 13-10.  Daniel Mears, Detroit News Fullscreen On the Lions' first play, Seahawks' Bobby Wagner brings down Lions running back Ameer Abdullah for a loss of three in the first quarter.  Daniel Mears, Detroit News Fullscreen Lions quarterback Matthew Stafford calls out at the line of scrimmage in the first quarter.  Daniel Mears, Detroit News Fullscreen Lions quarterback Matthew Stafford throws in the first quarter.  Daniel Mears, Detroit News Fullscreen In the first play, Seahawks running back Thomas Rawls is brought down by Lions' Josh Bynes and defense for a loss of three in the first quarter.  Daniel Mears, Detroit News Fullscreen Lions running back Ameer Abdullah heads up field for a first down run in the first quarter.  Daniel Mears, Detroit News Fullscreen Lions running back Ameer Abdullah avoids being taken down by Seahawks K.J. Wright and Kam Chancellor for a first-down run in the first quarter.  Daniel Mears, Detroit News Fullscreen Lions running back Ameer Abdullah works over Seahawks' Kam Chancellor in the first quarter.  Daniel Mears, Detroit News Fullscreen Lions defense stuff running back Thomas Rawls at the line of scrimmage, including Lions' Devin Taylor in the first quarter.  Daniel Mears, Detroit News Fullscreen Seahawks quarterback Russell Wilson chases down a bad snap from the center for a loss in the first quarter.  Daniel Mears, Detroit News Fullscreen Seahawks quarterback Russell Wilson is brought down by Lions' Josh Wilson after a bad snap from the center in the first quarter.  Daniel Mears, Detroit News Fullscreen Lions wide receiver Calvin Johnson is brought down after a reception by Seahawlks Cary Williams in the second quarter.  Daniel Mears, Detroit News Fullscreen Lions tight end Eric Ebron kneels on the ground for a while before being helped off the field in the second quarter.  Daniel Mears, Detroit News Fullscreen Punter Sam Martin taps kicker Matt Prater on the chest after a field goal in the second quarter.  Daniel Mears, Detroit News Fullscreen Lions' Ziggy Ansah brings down Seahawks running back Fred Jackson in the second quarter.  Daniel Mears, Detroit News Fullscreen Seahawks quarterback Russell Wilson runs into his own linemen and then is sacked by Lions defense for a loss in the second quarter.  Daniel Mears, Detroit News Fullscreen Lions fan Nathan Reitzell, 10, greets the Lions as they take the field.  Daniel Mears, Detroit News Fullscreen Brightly colored Seahawks and one Lions fan fill CenturyLink Field for Monday Night Football between the Detroit Lions and the Seattle Seahawks.  Daniel Mears, Detroit News Fullscreen Seahawks running back Marshawn Lynch, who is not scheduled to play due to injury, and Lions wide receiver Calvin Johnson talk on the field before Detroit takes on Seattle on Monday Night Football at CenturyLink Field in Seattle, Washington on October 5, 2015.  Daniel Mears, Detroit News Fullscreen Former Detroit Lions, now Seahawks defensive end Cliff Avril says "hello" to Lions wide receiver Calvin Johnson and Lions security Elton Moore on the field before the game.  Daniel Mears, Detroit News Fullscreen Lions wide receiver Calvin Johnson readies for a reception during warm-ups.  Daniel Mears, Detroit News Fullscreen Seahawks quarterback Russell Wilson comes onto the field to warm up before the game.  Daniel Mears, Detroit News Fullscreen Steve Young, Trent Dilfer, Suzy Kolber and Ray Lewis on the field before hosting Monday Night Countdown.  Daniel Mears, Detroit News Fullscreen Linebacker Ray Lewis, a 17-career NFL veteran, talks with safety James Ihedigbo on the sidelines during warm-ups.  Daniel Mears, Detroit News Fullscreen Lions quarterback Matthew Stafford joking around before warming up on the field.  Daniel Mears, Detroit News Fullscreen Lions tight end Eric Ebron contorts pulling in a reception during warm-ups.  Daniel Mears, Detroit News Fullscreen Lions wide receiver Calvin Johnson stretches before Monday Night Football against the Seattle Seahawks on the night they bring attention to breast cancer awareness with players wearing various pink equipment.  Daniel Mears, Detroit News Fullscreen Quarterback Steve Young tosses the ball around on the field before Monday Night Football.  Daniel Mears, Detroit News Fullscreen Lions wide receiver Golden Tate contorts pulling in a reception during warm-ups.  Daniel Mears, Detroit News Fullscreen Detroit Lions rookies running backs Ameer Abdullah and Zach Zenner stretch out on the field.  Daniel Mears, Detroit News Fullscreen Steve Young, hopefully showing the incorrect way to make a reception, jokes around with Ray Lewis on the field before hosting Monday Night Countdown.  Daniel Mears, Detroit News Fullscreen Lions quarterback Matthew Stafford jogs off the field after warm-ups and before Detroit takes on the Seattle Seahawks in Seattle.  Daniel Mears, Detroit News Fullscreen Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay Autoplay Show Thumbnails Show Captions Last Slide Next Slide Lions tight end Eric Ebron kneels on the ground for a while before being helped off the field in the second quarter. (Photo: Daniel Mears, Detroit News) 
Seattle â€” Lions tight end Eric Ebron looked ready to continue his impressive start to the 2015 season, but a left knee injury forced him to exit in the first half of Monday night's game against the Seahawks at CenturyLink Field.
On a run by Theo Riddick in the second quarter, Lions center Travis Swanson rolled into the back of Ebron's knee. After trainers checked on him, Ebron gingerly walked off the field under his own power, but had to go to the locker room shortly thereafter. He did not return.
Before the injury, Ebron had two catches for 22 yards. He had at least four catches and 43 yards in each of the first three games so far in his second NFL season. His injury left the Lions with just one healthy tight end, Tim Wright.
In addition to Ebron leaving, Lions linebacker Travis Lewis exited with an apparent right knee injury after a punt near the end of the second quarter. He had a trainer help him walk off the field and to the locker room before the Seahawks kneeled for the final play of the first half. Lewis played well in the first half with four tackles, two for loss and a sack.
Lewis returned for the third quarter.
Lions defensive tackle Haloti Ngata suffered a right calf injury, and the team announced him as questionable to return early in the third quarter.
At the br
eak, the Lions trailed the Seahawks, 10-3.
